page.title: 06HOUSES IN MERTON.
page.content: Hacun the Dane was the founder of Merton.The houses today have been built mainly along the straight street which runs through the centre of the village. Greenbelt policy has prevented Merton from growing bigger as it has been decided to keep land surrounding the village as farmland.Any new houses built recently have been built in existing spaces between the houses.Some of the houses have been built of Bradstone,others of red brick but the original houses were built of stone. Some houses are conversions of other buildings such as an old tithe barn, the old school,or a dovecote.There is only one working farm left in Merton. This is West End Farm which is situated behind the Plough Public House.The Public House is the oldest building in the village.It is currently having an extension added to house a restaurant.
